cooler noun [C]
(DRINK)
mainly US a cold drink, usually of wine, fruit juice, and fizzy water (= with bubbles): a wine/fruit cooler
cooler noun [C]
(PUNISHMENT)
the cooler informal
prison: This kind of fraud could get you a few months in the cooler.
a cell (= a small locked room) where someone is made to stay for a short time as a punishment, usually alone: The guards claimed he had to be put in the cooler for his own safety. If you get caught you must spend two weeks in the cooler in solitary confinement.
in some sports such as rugby or ice hockey, a place away from the playing area where a player has to stay for a short time during the game, as a punishment for breaking the rules: He spent 10 minutes in the cooler at the end of the first half after ignoring a warning from the referee. Synonyms
penalty box
sin bin
More examplesFewer examplesHe tells deadpan stories about his years "in the cooler."She has no money to pay a fine and nobody to stay with the kids if she goes to the cooler.Local cops said he was drunk and abusive and threw him in the cooler. The player behaved himself for a few minutes before tripping Mark Cueto, earning himself a spell in the cooler.The most aggressive hockey players spend the most time in the cooler.
